pull.title: guix: update time-machine to 43396dea109680d4ef7edf38991abdf9bfeccd66
pull.body:
Update the Guix time-machine to [43396dea109680d4ef7edf38991abdf9bfeccd66](https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/commit/43396dea109680d4ef7edf38991abdf9bfeccd66).

Package updates:
binutils 2.41 -> 2.44
cmake-minimal 3.24.2 -> 3.31.10
diffutils 3.10 -> 3.12
file 5.45 -> 5.46
git-minimal 2.46.0 -> 2.52.0
(base) glibc 2.39 -> 2.41
gzip 1.13 -> 1.14
linux-headers 6.1.119 -> 6.1.163
LLVM/Clang 19.1.4 -> 19.1.7
mingw-w64 12.0.0 -> 13.0.0
nsis 3.10 -> 3.11
python-minimal 3.10 -> 3.11

CMake 4.x becomes available.
Clang/LLVM 20 & 21 become available.

Switch to upstream `osslsigncode` (2.13, `python-lief` (0.17.3) and `python-oscrypto` (1.3.0) packages.

Update glibc to the latest commit on the `2.31` branch.

Could be used for #32764.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [pinheadmz](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34550#issuecomment-3921570371) | | Approach ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34550#pullrequestreview-3785949271) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#34547](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34547) (lint: modernise lint tooling by willcl-ark) * [#33593](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33593) (guix: Use UCRT runtime for Windows release binaries by hebasto) * [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) (guix: produce a `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> Switch to upstream `osslsigncode` (2.12) and `python-lief` (0.17.3) packages.

Switch to upstream `python-oscrypto` as well?

> Package updates:
> binutils 2.41 -> 2.44 
> cmake-minimal 3.24.2 -> 3.31.10 
> diffutils 3.10 -> 3.12 
> file 5.45 -> 5.46 
> git-minimal 2.46.0 -> 2.52.0 
> (base) glibc 2.39 -> 2.41 
> gzip 1.13 -> 1.14 
> linux-headers 6.1.119 -> 6.1.161 
> LLVM/Clang 19.1.4 -> 19.1.7 
> mingw-w64 12.0.0 -> 13.0.0 
> nsis 3.10 -> 3.11

Python is also updated:
```diff
--- a/contrib/guix/manifest.scm
+++ b/contrib/guix/manifest.scm
@@ -490,7 +490,7 @@ inspecting signatures in Mach-O binaries.")
         gnu-make
         ninja
         ;; Scripting
-        python-minimal ;; (3.10)
+        python-minimal ;; (3.11)
         ;; Git
         git-minimal
         ;; Tests
```

Approach ACK b3201fd12b3515b3fc9a84debbedf77e8e4653f4.

events.body: Updated to the latest Guix, and added a commit to bump glibc. Marked as reviewable.
guix building now. nit: hash in code matches PR title but not PR description ... ?

> nit: hash in code matches PR title but not PR description ... ?

Thanks, fixed up.

Something that has regressed is using `--system=riscv64-linux`:
```bash
          ADDITIONAL_GUIX_ENVIRONMENT_FLAGS: --system=riscv64-linux
          ADDITIONAL_GUIX_TIMEMACHINE_FLAGS: 
guix shell: error: package python-lief@0.17.3 does not support riscv64-linux
```

My Guix build output - matches fanquake's output

**Commit:** `e2af8bf`

> Something that has regressed is using `--system=riscv64-linux`:
> 
> ```shell
>           ADDITIONAL_GUIX_ENVIRONMENT_FLAGS: --system=riscv64-linux
>           ADDITIONAL_GUIX_TIMEMACHINE_FLAGS: 
> guix shell: error: package python-lief@0.17.3 does not support riscv64-linux
> ```

I suspect "does not support riscv64-linux" comes from one of its subdependencies. This is likely just an artificial limitation rather than a true incompatibility (the package author probably just hasn't tested it on RISC-V yet).

ACK e2af8bfe1cff

built and tested binary on x86/linux, did not review code

```
zip@zip:~/bitcoin$ ~/bitcoin/guix-build-e2af8bfe1cff/output/x86_64-linux-gnu/bitcoin-e2af8bfe1cff/bin/bitcoind -regtest
2026-02-18T15:44:32Z Bitcoin Core version v30.99.0-ge2af8bfe1cff48db84b5b6bc3dfb33e107d7db80 (release build)
```

comments.body: Maybe add an explanatory comment above, similar to how it's done for the other options?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,80 +152,6 @@ chain for " target " development."))
       (home-page (package-home-page pthreads-xgcc))
       (license (package-license pthreads-xgcc)))))
 
-;; While LIEF is packaged in Guix, we maintain our own package,
-;; to simplify building, and more easily apply updates.
-;; Moreover, the Guix's package uses cmake, which caused build
-;; failure; see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27296.
-(define-public python-lief
-  (package
-    (name "python-lief")
-    (version "0.16.6")
-    (source (origin
-              (method git-fetch)
-              (uri (git-reference
-                    (url "https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF")
-                    (commit version)))
